subject: Communication
title: Culture Shock: The U-Curve
description: A micro-lesson that makes Culture Shock: The U-Curve usable.

hook.text: The first month abroad is euphoria. The third month is misery. The sixth month is adaptation. There's a pattern.

buildup.text: The U-curve model maps cultural adjustment: honeymoon phase, crisis phase, adjustment phase, and adaptation phase.

discovery.text: Culture shock isn't weakness â€” it's the predictable psychological response to losing your familiar meaning-making.

twist.text: Returning home triggers 'reverse culture shock' â€” the W-curve. Your home feels foreign after you've changed abroad.

climax.text: Knowing the U-curve normalizes the discomfort. People who expect culture shock manage it better than those who don't.

punchline.text: Culture shock isn't a bug of travel. It's a feature of growth.

quiz.question: What does the U-curve model describe?
